intro: Adenocarpus telonensis, commonly known as the African milkweed, is a flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the family Fabaceae and is characterized by its compound leaves and showy yellow flowers. The plant produces small, pod-like fruits that contain seeds with tufts of hair for wind dispersal. It is adapted to arid environments and has a deep root system for water retention. Adenocarpus telonensis is also known for its milky sap, which can be toxic to some animals.
